Class ServeState

java.lang.Object
ServeState
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Comparable<ServeState>
public class ServeState
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<ServeState>
Creates an object to track current server availability and statistics such as. (i) Total time customers spent waiting (ii) Total customers served

  • Method Details

    • updateState

      public ServeState updateState​(double currTime, int avail, double nextPossibleServeTime)
      Updates currentTime, availability and nextPossibleServeTime.
      Parameters:
      currTime - The current session time
      avail - Availability of server
      nextPossibleServeTime - The next time a customer can be served
      Returns:
      A new ServeState object with the updated variables.

    • updateState

      public ServeState updateState​(double currTime, int avail, double totalWaitTime, int totalCusServed)
      Updates currentTime, availability, total wait time and total customers served.
      Parameters:
      currTime - The current session time
      avail - Availability of server
      totalWaitTime - Total time customers spent waiting
      totalCusServed - Total number of customers served
      Returns:
      A new ServeState object with the updated variables.

    • updateState

    • compareTo

      public int compareTo​(ServeState servestate)
      Comparable method to prioritize the states with the earlier time.
      Specified by:
      compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<ServeState>
      Parameters:
      servestate - compares 2 ServeStates
      Returns:
      int where -1 has a higher priority than 1
